intro: Hippochaete variegata var. anceps, commonly known as the variegated woollyhead, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive, woolly, silver-green foliage and showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in summer. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It typically grows as a low, spreading shrub with branched stems and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and landscapes in regions with suitable climates.
